page.title: 17BURTON SALMON FOOD 2
page.content: A survey was taken of the midday meals eaten by children during a school week in summer. The results show that the meals of all ages of children follow a similar pattern. Half the meals eaten were of sandwiches,a quarter were salads and the remainder were cooked meals. The sandwiches were made with a variety of fillings. The most common filling for the sandwiches of older children was cheese while the most common filling for younger children's sandwiches was jam. Chips provided the common base for the cooked meals accompanied by baked beans or peas with sausage or egg or ravioli. For evening meals beans on toast was the most common food. There was usually a pudding such as yoghurt.
